page.title: 12YOUNG CHORISTER AT DURHAM
page.content: Mark Frankham is a probationer in{ {Durham Cathedral Choir}and he boards at the Choir School nearby.His thirteen hour day is very involved. Prayers are said before breakfast,in the Assembly Hall,and after breakfast the choristers begin their musical day.School lessons begin at half past nine and continue until three forty. The choristers practise again and then sing Evensong.Half an hours' homework follows high tea and the day finishes at eight forty-five. Mark states that boarding makes him feel very grown-up and independent. He enjoys the{musical devotion}given by the choir,but the best thing to look forward to is when his parents visit him. He thoroughly enjoys his new life with all of the activities.
